chain_of_thought: [Article Type: Case Report] In this article, I found the following liver injury-related lab values and clinical outcomes: The patient is a 72-year-old male who developed liver injury after taking pyridostigmine. Lab results show peak AST of 1258 IU/L, peak ALT of 1235 IU/L, peak ALP of 741 IU/L, normal total bilirubin, peak INR of 2.19, and albumin not mentioned. The clinical outcome improved after discontinuing pyridostigmine, with liver function tests returning to normal within two weeks.

lab_results.Bilirubin: Normal (total bilirubin normal, no specific value or unit provided)
